result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orrin E Hunt-Haynes

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

DE appeared. DE to contact SPD to get Atty Martine appointed to the two newest cases. Parties requested status conference.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pretrial Services violation report; no change continue to monitor
Bail posted for defendant at DCJ before previous bail posted was applied.  Previous bail to be held until bail posted 9-27 received by court.

$1,000 CASH BAIL PREVIOUSLY POSTED TO BE APPLIED TO THIS BOND
Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with LMS or LDC.
- Defendant shall not be in the 4100 block of Alvarez Ave.
- Defendant shall comply with all geographic restrictions imposed in all open, applicable criminal cases.

Trial Judge - Br 17

1:45 PM Defendant Orrin E Hunt-Haynes in court, in custody.  Attorney Charles Kyle Kenyon Jr. in court for Orrin E Hunt-Haynes.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
